SENT.plain: A 71-year-old man sustains multiple fractures in an accident; after a lucid interval he deteriorates neurologically and becomes comatose
Intracranial hemorrhage, status epilepticus, adverse drug reactions, toxic-metabolic, ischemic or infectious causes are subsequently ruled out
Development of petechiae and thrombopenia raises the possibility of fat embolism syndrome, which is confirmed in a MRI of the head 72 hours after the accident
We discuss current aetiologic concepts as well as diagnosis and clinical course of the cerebral fat embolism syndrome
